title: GOP digs in on efforts to cut Amtrak funding
description: Democrats hammered Republicans for pushing cuts even in the wake of the crash. FULL STORY

title: Engineer apparently touted safety tools to override human error
description: The ride home on Amtrak Train 188 was mundane and relaxing as usual for Duy Nguyen, and he used the time Tuesday evening to call ahead to his wife Amy Dwyer in northern New Jersey on his cell phone.

title: What the U.S. can learn from European train safety
description: When an Amtrak train careened off the tracks in Philadelphia this week, it raised a host of questions over railroad safety.

title: ISIS launches major offensive
description: ISIS has launched a wide-scale attack in Ramadi, the governor said. FULL STORY

title: Blues legend B.B. King dies
description: B.B. King, the legendary guitarist whose velvety voice and staccato-picking style brought blues from the margins to the mainstream, died Thursday night, his daughter said. FULL STORY

title: U.S. copter crash found in Nepal
description: It was spotted on the slopes of a mountain east of Kathmandu, a local army official said. FULL STORY

title: Coup fails, leaders arrested
description: Burundian authorities arrested the military generals behind an attempted coup, including its leader Godefroid Niyombare, a government spokesman said Friday.

title: 'Bomb' trains threaten towns
description: On the surface, this is a tidy, upscale community in suburban Chicago where the biggest headache is the commute to downtown.

title: 'Black people' remark: Principal fired
description: A Georgia educator who was caught on camera calling out "all the black people" for leaving a graduation ceremony during the valedictorian's speech has been fired.

title: Denali climber found dead
description: The body of a 39-year-old solo climber was discovered Sunday at the 17,200-foot high camp of Mount McKinley in Alaska's Denali National Park.

title: Teen climber survives avalanche
description: When the wall of snow came roaring down the mountain, 17-year-old Matt Moniz jumped behind a boulder with his climbing partners, unsure whether he would survive.

title: Surprise birth traps U.S. mom in Hong Kong
description: Wendy Morrow, who was seven months pregnant, was ready to board the plane at the Hong Kong International Airport to visit her brother in Xiamen, China, but moments before she got to the gate -- her water broke.

title: Fans from 'expensive seats' attack soccer players
description: Argentine fans were labeled as "sick" by Boca Juniors' president as one of the world's most famous football rivalries descended into chaos forcing the abandonment of the latest edition of the "Superclasico."

title: Dishwasher lost 100 lbs. by eating on the job
description: Laying at the bottom of a skateboard pool in 2011, Lucas Weaver had -- quite literally -- reached rock bottom. He fell while working promotions at a skating competition and tore every ligament in his knee.

title: 'Mad Max: Fury Road' driving critics wild
description: Hollywood's appetite for sequels and reboots shows no sign of weakening, but "Mad Max: Fury Road" is one instance in which that's a very good thing, critics agree.

title: Husband's last text haunts distraught wife
description: A woman says she received a suicidal text message from her husband moments before her Southwest flight took off and the flight crew did not let her call to try to stop him. WTMJ reports.

title: Found: First warm-blooded fish
description: The opah, or moonfish, a large colourful fish living across the world's oceans, has been found to have a warm heart and maintain a high body temperature, according to a report in the journal Science. Turns out, it's been hiding in plain sight on our dinner plates.

title: Depp's dogs flying back to America
description: Johnny Depp may have been a success as swashbuckling Capt. Jack Sparrow, but any potential smuggling career of his own has hit a large rock in the shape of Australia.

title: 40% of food goes to waste: One man's solution
description: Like many children, Robert Lee was taught never to waste food. But growing up the son of Korean immigrants who struggled to get by, he really took the idea to heart.

title: Romney in spotlight with Holyfield fight
description: The Mitt Romney of 2012 would never have dreamed of climbing into the ring with former heavyweight champion Evander Holyfield.

title: The mystery inside Amtrak train's cab
description: The rules by which trains operate on American railroads were written in blood. As the rail network developed in the 19th century, every accident was a lesson learned -- and brought a new rule to prevent it from happening again. Today the General Code of Operating Rules is a 167-page collection of lessons learned. But even 185 years of experience haven't yet protected railroads from the danger no rule can banish: simple human error.

title: Wanted: Tough, feminine soldiers
description: Army Sgt. Corrin Campbell is a chameleon. Tough combat U.S. Army veteran. Buttoned up officer. And that female singer with the pink hair and the red lips, on a high school stage, belting out Taylor Swift's' "Blank Space."

title: What we are getting wrong about crash
description: The derailment of an Amtrak train near Philadelphia, which claimed the lives of eight people and injured more than 200 more passengers, is only the latest in a rash of serious railroad accidents this year. In February, a Metro-North Railroad crash near Valhalla, New York, killed six people and injured 15 others. Meanwhile, there have been several significant derailments of oil trains that have caused spills and fires around the country.

title: Was it sexist to call Warren 'Elizabeth'?
description: Well into his second term in office, you'd think the President would have toughened up a bit.

title: Obama out of step with 'dance' partners
description: What we have been watching is a carefully choreographed diplomatic dance, starring President Barack Obama and the Arab leaders who came to the United States for high-level talks at Camp David, Maryland. But the truth is that Obama's dance partners started moving to a different beat even before they arrived.

title: The week in 35 photos

description: You can tell a lot about a person from their expressions. Perplexed eyebrows, pursed lips.

title: Miley, 'Scrubs' stars, Bieber and more

description: NOAA ship Okeanos Explorer uses remote operated vehicles to capture imagery of deep sea wildlife.

title: Winston the python bites off more than he can chew
description: An Adelaide snake owner had to take his python for emergency medical treatment after the animal swallowed a set of barbecue tongs that were being used to feed him a rat.

title: Behold 'self-healing' concrete
description: It's the world's most popular building material, and ever since the Romans built the pantheon from it some 2,000 years ago, we've been trying to find ways to make concrete more durable.

title: Engaged young couple made over to look 70 years older
description: A month before they get married, this couple got a peak into their future with the help of life-like makeup and prosthetics.

title: Is this the worst idea ever for a TV game show?
description: "Labor Games" is exactly what it sounds like -- moms in labor participating in a game show on TLC. CNN's Lisa France says it's "evil genius."

title: Fast food worker's kind act caught on camera
description: Qdoba restaurant employee goes above and beyond to help disabled customer. WAVE has more.

title: Adult kids flip out over moms' lie detector answers
description: See what happens after these moms are hooked up to lie detector tests.

title: What a shot! 42 amazing sports photos
description: Take a look at 42 amazing sports pictures from May 5 through May 11.

title: Portraits of Africa, taken from the sky
description: Jan and Jay Roode capture Africa's hidden moments from the seat of their plane.

title: In my backyard: Iceland
10 most scenic airports
Pentagon hunts for ISIS on the secret Internet
description: After months of bombing by the U.S. and coalition forces, ISIS remains undefeated on the ground and has now entered a new phase, using the cyber-world as a weapon.

title: Swedish 'gay sailor' to deter Russian subs
description: Ever wondered how to keep suspected Russian submarines out of your territorial waters?

title: China warns U.S. Navy
description: The U.S. is considering deploying aircraft and ships to contest Chinese claims to disputed islands in the South China Sea, U.S. officials said Wednesday.

title: The history-making, chaotic evacuation of Saigon
description: The CIA Air America helicopter bounced as it touched down on an aging apartment building in Saigon.

title: Helmet lets pilots see through plane

description: If you think networks like Fox, ABC and CBS are driving a superhero trend on TV, they've got nothing on the CW.

title: 7 'Simpsons' voices that will soon sound different
description: For nearly 600 episodes of "The Simpsons," Harry Shearer has been the voice of many of the show's most iconic characters -- among them Principal Skinner, Ned Flanders and Montgomery Burns.

title: 'Idol' picks winner, gets ready for final season
description: In a star-studded season 14 finale, Nick Fradiani was anointed the latest "American Idol."

title: Muppets return to prime time
description: It's time to play the music; it's time to light the lights ... Tuesday nights at 8 ET, to be exact.

title: Frequent tanner shares grisly skin-cancer selfie
Five Iranian boats fire shots
description: Five Iranian boats fired shots across the bow of a Singapore flagged cargo vessel in the Persian Gulf on Thursday in an attempt to potentially stop the ship, a U.S. official told CNN. For the first time, the incident brought another Persian Gulf nation into the recent rising maritime tensions in the region.

title: Goodell to decide Brady appeal
description: It's official: New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady will fight the four-game suspension the NFL dealt him this week.

title: Most valuable car in the world, and why it matters
See birth of baby beluga whale
description: The Georgia Aquarium welcomes a beluga whale calf. Her mother, Maris, gave birth to her on Mother's Day.

title: 'CSI' canceled; are your other faves safe?
Rock singer discloses mental disorder
description: There was a time last fall when Creed lead singer Scott Stapp claimed he was "penniless," had taken to living in a Holiday Inn and was convinced his family was involved in ISIS.

title: Reporter turns tables on obscene hecklers
description: An obscene taunt backfires when a reporter gets fed up. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports on the backlash against vulgar hecklers.

title: Inside an upscale North Korean apartment
description: CNN's Will Ripley was given rare access to an upscale area of Pyongyang near Kim Il Sung University, where he was allowed to see the inside of a faculty apartment.
